data.title: 64 People of belleville ontario Images: PICRYL
data.meta_description: Download Images of  - Free for commercial use, no attribution required. From: Hastings County Archives 2017-100 000.507.002 (38411130466), to HC08220 (46983790795). Find  images dated from 1850 to 2017.
data.meta_site_name: PICRYL - Public Domain Media Search Engine
data.text: Hastings County Archives 2017-100 000.507.002 (38411130466) Photograph of two small children, taken by Harry K. Smith of Front Street, Belleville, Ontario. Transferred from Glanmore National Historic Site in November 2017. Originally donated to Glanmore in July 2000 by ... More Hastings County Archives 2017-100 000.507.004 (38411125226) Photograph of a young man, taken by Durwood A. Weese of Belleville, Ontario. Transferred from Glanmore National Historic Site in November 2017. Originally donated to Glanmore in July 2000 by Julie Sager. Hastings County Archives 2017-100 982.009.015 (24566552158) Portrait of elderly David Caldwell of Thurlow Township near Foxboro by Thomas Donohue of Belleville, Ontario. There was a David Caldwell of Thurlow who was born on October 6th, 1840. He died on February 19th, 1 ... More Hastings County Archives 2017-100 982.009.016 (24566550068) Portrait of an elderly man by Smith & Clarke, Belleville, Ontario. “W.C. Wells, Allan Salisbury’s grandfather” is written on the back. William Casey Wells was born in Fredericksburgh, Ontario in 1826 and marrie ... More Hastings County Archives 2017-100 982.009.018 (24566548548) Mr and Mrs Myron Hawley, taken by William Spence Clarke of Belleville, Ontario. Myron Hawley married Mary Elizabeth Beatrice Thompson on December 13th, 1905 in Thurlow Township. Transferred from Glanmore Natio ... Transferred from Glanmore National Historic Site in November 2017. Originally owned by Lily Vanderwater (formerly Ketcheson, 1902-1992). Originally owned by Lily Vanderwater (formerly Ketcheson, 1902-1992). Transferred from Glanmore National Historic Site in November 2017. Originally owned by Lily Vanderwater (formerly Ketcheson, 1902-1992). Transferred from Glanmore National Historic Site in November 2017. Hastings County Archives 2017-37 (2) (34455123222) Photographic portrait of three nurses by Robert McCormick of Belleville, Ontario. The nurses are Adelia Leslie (standing), Doris Hogle (left) and Evelyn Ethier (right). They graduated in May 1936 from the Belle ... Donated by Kerry Warbis-Bernier, January 2018. Part of the https://discover.cabhc.ca/hannah-harrison-collection" Hannah Harrison collection, donat ... Front row: Ashley Boyd, Harold Woodley, Clare Leavens; middle row: Jack Yerex, George Woodley, ?, ... More Hastings County Archives HC01341 (35302997575) Old Boys Reunion Group Photo (used in W. C. Mikel's 'City of Belleville, History') Back row, left to right: G. E. Connelly, Rochester, N.Y.; George B. Newberry, St. Louis, Mo.; Alfred Gillen, Belleville; H. B. ... More Hastings County Archives HC01495 (35747031432) Fire Chief William J. Brown, who was killed in a fire at the Corbin Lock Factory in Belleville, Ontario on 20 September 1929, aged 72. Photograph by Robert McCormick, donated by Harold Brown. Hastings County Archives HC01496 (35876161166) Portrait of Harry S. Burrell (1870-1917), owner of the Burrell Rock Drill and Mining Tools Company in Belleville, Ontario. Photo donated by Albert Stapley in July 1962. Hastings County Archives HC01615 (front) (37133768616) Photograph of a man, woman, and baby, taken by David Whatmough of Belleville, Ontario. Mikel's 1943 'City of Belleville History', with the following caption: "The Late ... More Hastings County Archives HC01644 (37333580255) William Warren Dean (1830-1905), the first Master-in-Chancery at Belleville, Ontario. Retired in 1874 on being appointed Judge of the County Court of the County of Victoria. This photograph appears on page 268 ... More Hastings County Archives HC01788 (21326269358) Photograph of a portrait of Billa Flint of Belleville, Ontario. Public domain photograph of Canadian male portrait, 19th century personalities, free to use, no copyright restrictions image - Picryl description Hastings County Archives HC01803 (24961180448) Photograph of Gilbert Hall French (1878-1944), produce dealer and Alderman of the City of Belleville, Ontario, between 1921 and 1930, Governor of Hastings County Gaol until 1941. He lived at 40 Bridge Street We ... More Hastings County Archives HC01947 (24981063608) Reproduction of a portrait of Thomas Holden, Q. C. (1840-1884), police magistrate of Belleville, Ontario from 1881 to 1883. Used by W. C. Mikel in his history of Belleville (page 269). Hastings County Archives HC02186 (38516748452) Portrait of Stewart Masson, K.C. (1857-1926), police magistrate for the city of Belleville, Ontario, from 1898 until 1926. Burnham 6. Pte. Hammond 7. Pte. Baker 8. Pte. Palmer 9. Pte. ... More Hastings County Archives HC02351 (21678131886) Two men and a woman outside. The man on the left is William Nisbet Ponton (1857-1938), a barrister from Belleville, Ontario. Hastings County Archives HC02355 Richard Ponton (21516378058) Richard Douglas Ponton, son of Col. W. N. Ponton of Belleville. Major/Judge R. D. Ponton lived with his wife Olive Agnew at 207 Bridge Street east. He died May 13, 1933. Hastings County Archives HC02356 (38419184940) Portrait by William Spence Clarke of a young man in the uniform of the Argyll Light Infantry. Donated by Mrs W. N. Ponton, possibly Richard Douglas Ponton (1889-1933). Hastings County Archives HC02358 (21704182355) Richard Douglas Ponton aboard a ship. Photo from W .N. Ponton estate. Major and Judge Richard D Ponton, born at Sidney cottage, Dundas Street West, in October 1890. According to the Ontario Intelligencer, he di ... More Hastings County Archives HC02366 (39553182534) James Ernest Walmsley (1854-1940), grocer, who was Mayor of Belleville, Ontario, from 1894 to 1897. Photograph taken by Durwood A. Weese of Belleville. Hastings County Archives HC02479 (26512372098) Photograph of a standing woman and dog, by Notman and Fraser of King Street, Toronto. A note on the back reads "Mrs (Dr) Ridley, 1880". Hastings County Archives HC02480 (38574198390) Photograph by Durwood A. Weese of Belleville, Ontario, showing a young man's head and shoulders. "Son of H. Ridley" has been added in pencil. Hastings County Archives HC02482 (38628424240) Photograph by Robert Milne of Hamilton, Ontario. On the back is written "Geo. N. Ridley" (George Neville Ridley was a Belleville doctor who died in 1857, aged 63, while Milne's photographic business began in 18 ... More Hastings County Archives HC02486 (front) (40396312382) Hand-tinted photograph of a man in military uniform, identified as Fred Ridley (probably the son of Dr George Neville Ridley (1794-1857) of Belleville, Ontario, who lived 1839-1882). Photograph by Forrest and ... More Hastings County Archives HC02487 (front) (40396303142) Photograph of a seated man, identified as Charles Ridley, who was a doctor in Belleville, Ontario and lived from 1825 to 1892. Photo by George McConkey of Toronto. Hastings County Archives HC02491 (25571730027) Photograph identified as Baroness de Rottenburg: this is Louisa Mary Ridley (1823-1891), eldest child of George Neville Ridley, a physician who settled in Belleville, Ontario. She married George Frederick de Ro ... More Hastings County Archives HC02495 (38689519130) Photograph by Robert McCormick of Belleville, Ontario, showing Mary Ritchie (lived 1842-1929, formerly Mary Holden) and her Sunday School class from the John Street Church, Belleville. Hastings County Archives HC02496 (26629166998) Thomas Ritchie (1838-1921) of Belleville, Ontario, and his wife, Mary (formerly Holden), standing, with Agnes Ritchie, Thomas's sister, seated. They are on the verandah of a house, with chairs in the background ... More HC08144 (47060804084) The staff at C.P.R. telegraph, circa 1941-1942. Left to right: Jack Hinchey (general manager); Clarence Cook (assistant manager); Teddy Dobbs, Theresa Keon, Beverly Goodfellow (students); front: Denny Rosatte ... More HC08123 (47849698791) Peter Richardson helps two young children hold a trophy. The plaque on the trophy reads: Lasalle PHSTU (?) Trophy for Best School Float Presented by: Stu Peters (?) Belleville, Ontario HC08124 (47797545792) Two men photographed--the one the right, David Thompson, is holding a hammer. The man on the left is unidentified. Hastings County Archives HC02165 (front) (38928565684) Stereoscopic photograph of Masonic temple members of Belleville, Ontario. Members (not all pictured) are: Sid Savage, Tom ?, Pete Copeland, Jack Fox, Ned Holden, Harry Dupont, Jim Whiteford, Sgt. Tom Hackett, ... Bottoms, William Scholes, William Johnson and Jeremiah Thompson of No. 1 Company, 15th Battalion of the Volunteer Militia, called into service on March 8th, 1866 during the Fenian Raids. P ... More Hastings County Archives HC02343 (back) (26300142258) Printed text reads: "A. M. Terwilligar, Photographer, Belleville, C.W." Added in ink is "Anne Ponton & her son Augustine Apl. 10. 63" (Hutton) Hastings County Archives HC01711 (38360721786) Group of teachers from Moira Secondary School, Belleville, Ontario, visiting the Royal Canadian Air Force base at Trenton, Ontario. The group are standing with an Air Force officer in front of an aircraft. HC08220 (46983790795) Adults and children take part in a three-legged race at Zwick's Island in Belleville, Ontario. The man in the yellow shirt is Brett Neilson.
